name: Athens
fun_fact: Fun fact: The earliest evidence of a Greek restaurant was discovered at the Ancient Agora of Athens in the 1970s, complete with cooking utensils, plates, and meat spits! The taverna tradition has been part of Athens' DNA since ancient times.

hero_dishes.name: Souvlaki
hero_dishes.description: Skewers of grilled meat (typically pork or chicken, also lamb and beef) served with pita bread, fresh vegetables, and tzatziki sauce. The most popular street food in Athens.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Souvlaki is as beloved by locals as tourists and represents Athens' street food culture. Often wrapped in pita with tomatoes, onions, and tzatziki, it's the quintessential quick meal found on every corner.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Street vendors and tavernas throughout Monastiraki, Psirri, and Plaka neighborhoods

hero_dishes.name: Moussaka
hero_dishes.description: A sort of eggplant lasagna with layer after layer of thinly sliced eggplant coated in spiced ground meat, cheese, and creamy bÃ©chamel sauce. Can also include potato layers.
hero_dishes.origin_story: One of Greece's most iconic dishes, moussaka represents the country's Mediterranean comfort food tradition with Ottoman and Byzantine influences.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional tavernas in Plaka (Stamatopoulos since 1882, Psarras since 1898, Klimataria since 1927)

hero_dishes.name: Grilled Octopus
hero_dishes.description: Tender octopus char-grilled and served with olive oil and lemon
hero_dishes.origin_story: A classic mezze dish showcasing Greece's seafood heritage and simple, quality-focused Mediterranean cooking
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Seafood tavernas like Psarras, coastal restaurants, traditional mezedopoleia

hero_dishes.name: Meze Platters
hero_dishes.description: Small plates including tzatziki (yogurt-cucumber dip), dolmades (stuffed grape leaves), fried zucchini, taramosalata, and more
hero_dishes.origin_story: Meze culture is central to Greek dining - sharing small plates with wine or ouzo, encouraging conversation and leisurely meals
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Ouzeri and mezedopoleia in Monastiraki and Psirri, Ouzeri Karyiannis in Central Markets

signature_drinks.name: Retsina
signature_drinks.description: Resinated wine with a distinctive pine resin flavor, the quintessential Greek wine
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Traditionally drawn from wooden barrels at tavernas, served in small glasses or carafes. No visit to Athens is complete without sipping retsina at a traditional taverna.

signature_drinks.name: Ouzo
signature_drinks.description: Anise-flavored Greek spirit, often compared to pastis or sambuca
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served at cafeneio (traditional cafes) with a plate of mezedes so you never drink without eating. Locals gather to talk politics, play backgammon, and sip ouzo throughout the afternoon and evening.

signature_drinks.name: Greek Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Strong, unfiltered coffee served in small cups with thick grounds at the bottom
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Sipped slowly at traditional cafeneio while socializing, reading newspapers, or playing backgammon
